Benzema’s new Real Madrid deal is a priority for the club with PSG, Lyon offers. The forward’s current contract expires in 2021 and while both parties are keen to extend it, interest from Ligue 1 has the Bernabéu concerned. [as]

Real Madrid and particularly Zinedine Zidane are more than happy to accommodate Benzema, whose current deal expires in 2021.

The only question is how long the extension will be. Real have tabled an offer until 2023, which would take Benzema up to his 35th birthday and probable retirement as a Real Madrid player.

Benzema is apparently considering suggesting an extra year on his current deal with the option of another if he feels he is still performing at a level high enough to warrant it.
Official | Belgium’s Player of the Year

Karim Benzema will be a Real Madrid player until at least 2022 after the French striker reached an agreement with the club. [Marca]

The deal will be officially signed in the summer and extends Benzema’s time with Real Madrid by one year as his current deal expires in 2021.
Real Madrid will encourage Brahim to stay next month but with the lack of play time he could be loaned out for 6-months with Espanyol being favourites to sign him in the coming window. [@diarioas]

Lille have received six proposals for Boubakary Soumaré

L’Équipe report that Ligue 1 side Lille have received about a half-dozen proposals for 20-year-old midfielder Boubakary Soumaré ahead of the January transfer window.

Les Dogues refused Wolves’ €40m offer that came in several months ago.

There are three options for the French youth international midfielder going into next month: a permanent move, a permanent move but loaned back to Lille until the end of the season, a permanent move at the end of the season.

Manchester United, Tottenham, Napoli, Real Madrid and Valencia are all interested in a deal.

Paul Pogba: Since returning to Real Madrid it's been Zidane's biggest wish to sign Pogba.

The breakthrough of Fede Valverde has taken the attention off Pogba, but Zidane won't give up on signing his compatriot. [@Marca]

Kylian Mbappe: Florentino's dream signing - he's more than ready to leave PSG for Real Madrid.

With his contract at PSG ending in 2022, this year will be pivotal in the future of Mbappe. Signing him this summer looks very difficult, but it might just happen. [@Marca]
James Rodriguez: His contract expires in 2021 and Real Madrid are not keen on renewing his contract so he's very likely to be sold in the summer. [@Marca]

Martin Ødegaard: Real Madrid are thrilled with his performances - at the end of the season Real and Sociedad will sit down and discuss his future but it's very very unlikely that he stays on loan for one more year. But Martin doesn't want to be a bench player. [@Marca]
å¤§åŠ›ç¥20mç°½ç•ªé»è¸¢å¾Œå‚™éƒ½å¥½

Luka Modric: His situation is very similar to Sergio Ramos and it's unclear if he'll stay beyond this season. Inter and AC Milan are both monitoring his situation at Madrid. [@Marca]

Sergio Ramos: The captain will be 34 in March and talks to extend his contract, which expires in 2021, are ongoing.

The club's policy is to not offer players over 32 any new deals longer than a year, so will Ramos accept this? [@Marca]

Luka Jovic: Real are expecting more from Jovic who has scored just one goal this season so far. It's hard to see Madrid challenging for the LaLiga title with just Karim Benzema contributing in the attacking department. [@Marca]

‘Reinier even better than Kaka in some ways’ – Filipe Luis says Real Madrid are getting ‘great signing’

"I remember Kaka because he played with his head up, and he was lethal in the area," Filipe Luis told Marca.

"Reinier has even more quality than Kaka with his back to goal.

"Time will tell whether or not he is like Kaka."

Filipe Luis added: "He has surprised me at 17 in that he always chooses the correct option.

"When he has to pass, he passes, he plays with his head up.

"It really is a great signing, I congratulate Real Madrid.

"He isn't 100 per cent ready. He is 17 years old, but has potential and a great future.

"Nobody is ever ready for a leap so vast at that age, but in the future he will be a great signing."
